#Text=Bush pledges support for Turkey after meeting with PM
#Text=Tuesday , November 6 , 2007
#Text=On Monday , the Prime Minister of Turkey , Recep Tayyip Erdoğan paid an official state visit to the United States .
#Text=During his visit , he met with President George W. Bush in the White House for talks that centered on the Turkey-PKK conflict and the Iraq War .
#Text=Turkey is concerned about attacks by the Kurdistan Workers Party ( PKK ) that originate from within the borders of Iraq .
#Text=There have been cross-border clashes between Turkey and the PKK .
#Text=Turkey has threatened a major incursion , something the US seeks to avoid , as it could upset the relative calm in northern Iraq .
#Text=The PKK has been listed as a terrorist organization by a number of countries and organizations .

#Text=The PKK 's goal has been to create an independent socialist Kurdish state in a territory which it claims as Kurdistan , an area that comprises parts of south-eastern Turkey , north-eastern Iraq , north-eastern Syria and north-western Iran .
#Text=After the meeting , Bush said of the PKK that " they are an enemy of Turkey , they are an enemy of Iraq , and they are an enemy of the United States .

#Text= He pledged additional intelligence to help Turkey , an offer that was also made by Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice last week , during her Middle East tour .

column1: #Text=Erdogan mentioned during the post-meeting news conference that the Grand National Assembly of Turkey has already authorized military action in Iraq .
#Text=He did not , however , say whether such action would be imminent .
#Text=“ There is a lot of difficulty in the region in general .
#Text=And I believe that it falls to us , it 's a responsibility for us as strategic partners to work to ensure that we overcome these difficulties and solve them .
#Text=I have also seen that the President and I agree on these points , and I 'm very happy to see that .
#Text=” — Recep Tayyip Erdoğan
#Text=Neither leader indicated to what level , if any , that direct military cooperation would exist .
#Text=Ali Babacan , the Minister of Foreign Affairs for Turkey , was last week not so impressed by Rice 's offers .
#Text=" We are at the point where words have been exhausted and where there is need for action , " he said on Friday .
#Text="

#Text=The Bush administration would like to just kick this can down the road ,  said Bulent Aliriza , a political observer for the Center for Strategic and International Studies .
